intro: Trineuria chenopoda, commonly known as sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, green to reddish leaves that are typically succulent, allowing it to store water efficiently. Its flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, often with pale green or yellow petals. Trineuria chenopoda is adapted to thrive in harsh, dry environments and is often found in sandy or gravelly soils.
